text: Richard Bernard Halligan (August 29, 1943 â€“ January 18, 2022) was an American musician and composer. He was best known as a founding member of the jazz-rock band Blood, Sweat & Tears. He won a Grammy Award in 1970. He composed the movie scores for Go Tell the Spartans (1978), Cheaper to Keep Her (1981), Fear City (1984), and the Chuck Norris movies A Force of One (1979) and The Octagon (1980). Halligan died in Rome on January 18, 2022, at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:American rock musicians Category:American pop musicians Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pianists Category:American trombonists Category:Musicians from New York (state) Category:People from Troy, New York
title: Dick Halligan
